Testimony from Texas Governor Rick Perry: The claim was initially made by Texas Governor Rick Perry during an interview with Glenn Beck. Perry expressed concern about border-crossing immigrants committing crimes and specifically mentioned the number of homicides committed by "illegal aliens" over the past six years.
Reference to Texas Department of Public: DPS) data: Perry's spokesperson directed fact-checkers to consult the Texas Department of Public Safety for verification of the claim. DPS Director Steve McCraw also mentioned the high number of criminal aliens arrested for non-immigration crimes, including "over 3,000 homicides" since 2008, in his testimony to the U.S. House Committee on Homeland Security.
Texas Criminal Alien Arrest Data: The DPS provided a web page titled "Texas Criminal Alien Arrest Data" which contained relevant information supporting the claim. The page stated that from October 2008 through July 1, 2014, Texas had identified a total of 203,685 unique criminal alien defendants booked into Texas county jails, responsible for at least 3,070 homicides.
Verification of data accuracy: The DPS clarified that the numbers provided were minimum figures as they only included aliens whose fingerprints were already in the federal system when they were booked. It was acknowledged that the data may not include all incarcerated individuals in federal prison.
